Client Server validation

  • By Artem V. Shamsutdinov
  • August 12th, 2022

Modern SPA applications must validate data coming from the client. AIRport's entity driven approach and declarative programming allows for concise and reader-friendly validation declarations, re-used on client and server.

I recently proposed a re-write of a legacy application to a modern SPA. The the main concern for the rewrite was the lack of server session state in SPA applications.

In traditional Web frameworks like JSF the views are rendered on the server and the state of the application always stays in the controlled environment on the session, where it is guaranteed to be valid. In modern SPA applications the state is sent to (and created on) the Client and must be validated when it is recieved by the Server.

This places an additional burden on the developer, requiring them to write procedural validation logic that is verbose, hard to read and tedious to write (and is therefore error prone).
